info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 30 at 3:59AM CST until February 01 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...A couple of rounds of light snow, sleet, and light freezing rain are expected. Precipitation should mainly occur today through this evening, and again on Tuesday into Tuesday night. Ice accurals should be less than a quarter inch, with snow and sleet accumulations less than a half inch. * WHERE...Northern Arkansas * WHEN...Until 9 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory means that periods of snow...sleet...or freezing rain will cause travel difficulties. Be prepared for slippery roads and limited visibilities...and use caution while driving. Be sure to check road conditions before traveling in these areas. Visit the Arkansas Department of Transportation`s website Idrivearkansas.com for the latest road and traffic conditions.
